text: this is how you eat my cheese at my
house hey guys angel here today I'm
going to show you how to make green tea
much of bubble waffles a few videos ago
I made regular bubble waffles and I
asked you guys what flavors you wanted
to see you next some of you said matcha
and some of you also said mochi stuff so
today I'm going to show you how to make
matcha mochi stuffed bubble waffles wow
that was a huge phrase there matcha
mochi bubbles and I'm even gonna show
you how to make it ala mode which is my
favorite way to eat these bubble waffles
so I have all my equipment out here I've
got my egg waffle maker and I also have
some mini Mochis which I'm going to use
in this recipe if you guys don't know
where to get mini Mochis sometimes they
sell it at your local Asian grocery
store or you can even do what I did
which is buy them online and implicitly
to that in the video description below
if you're interested so with that let's
get started first the ingredients for
this recipe we'll start with 1 cup of
cake flour 1/2 a cup of cane sugar 1
teaspoon of baking powder and 1
tablespoon of matcha green-tea powder
sift the dry ingredients together first
with the whisk before adding 1 TSP of
vegetable oil or any other neutral
flavored oil is fine 2 large eggs a tiny
splash of vanilla for extra flavor and
finally 1/2 a cup of filtered water
carefully mix all those ingredients
together until well combined before
transferring the batter to an easy pour
container when you're done you should
have just under 2 cups of batter which
is enough to make 2 large egg waffles
next pre-heat your waffle maker and when
it's ready spray with a light coating of
oil before adding a small amount of
batter then add in your mini row cheese
cover with a bit more batter and close
the lid and flip your waffle maker to
let it cook so this should take three to
five minutes depending on how soft or
how crispy you like your bubble waffles
when the waffles are done carefully
remove them and let it cool for a few
minutes before serving hot
[Music]
and if you guys want to make this
dessert Alamo you could always make this
a super bubble matcha waffle add some
whipped cream to the top arrange some
sliced strawberries around the side two
scoops of green tea ice cream and
finally topping it all off with a bit
more whipped cream then drizzling with
chocolate syrup because hey you only
live once that's how you make much of
bubble waffles with mochi as you can see
